channel.title: Feeds.foxnews.com on Daytona 500 | The Great American Race
channel.description: Recent content in Feeds.foxnews.com on Daytona 500 | The Great American Race

item.title: After Trump strikes Islamist terrorists, US general travels to Nigeria with militants 'on the run'
item.description: Lt. Gen. John Brennan details U.S. military support helping Nigerian forces combat Islamic State and Boko Haram terrorists following strikes that disrupted terror networks.

item.title: Anti-ICE protests take place as T'Wolves-Warriors NBA game takes place
item.description: Anti-ICE messages filled the Target Center on Sunday as the Minnesota Timberwolves took on the Golden State Warriors after another day of unrest.

item.title: Barack and Michelle Obama slam ICE after Minneapolis shooting, urge accountability
item.description: Barack and Michelle Obama condemned federal immigration tactics in Minnesota after Alex Pretti's fatal shooting in Minneapolis on Saturday.

item.title: Bill Clinton says Trump admin 'told us not to believe what we've seen' after latest Minnesota shooting
item.description: Former President Bill Clinton said federal immigration agents are engaging in "increasingly aggressive and antagonistic tactics" after another fatal shooting in Minnesota.

item.title: China's top general ousted, placed under investigation in latest military purge
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping removed China's top general Zhang Youxia amid an investigation for violating party discipline in latest military purge.

item.title: Dana White pulls UFC 324 fight after betting irregularities: 'I'm not doing this s--- again'
item.description: Another UFC betting scandal emerged, but it was caught before the fight as CEO Dana White pulled the Michael Johnson-Alex Hernandez bout at UFC 324 on Saturday night.

item.title: Drake Maye's controversial fourth-down play sparks social media fury as Patriots head to Super Bowl LX
item.description: A game-changing fourth-and-1 conversion by Drake Maye sent Patriots to Super Bowl LX despite officials' disputed call that Broncos challenged unsuccessfully.

item.title: Emory fires Iranian official's daughter after campus protests over controversial hiring decision
item.description: Fatemeh Ardeshir-Larijani, daughter of sanctioned Iranian official Ali Larijani, lost her position at Emory University as activists called for review of her immigration status.

item.title: Federal immigration officials privately fume over DHS claims after deadly Minnesota shooting
item.description: Federal immigration officials say DHS mishandled messaging after a deadly Border Patrol shooting, hurting morale and credibility and sparking internal backlash.

item.title: How the Oct 7 Hamas terror attacks exposed long-running concerns about UNRWA, new film charges
item.description: Tracing UNRWA from 1949 to today, the film examines refugee policy, weak oversight and alleged links to Hamas control in Gaza, raising questions about the agency’s role and accountability.

item.title: ICE says violent mob helped criminal escape and left ICE agent permanently maimed
item.description: Federal officials say Minneapolis unrest derailed immigration arrest, leaving suspect at large while ICE agent lost part of finger to agitator bite.

item.title: Iranian drone swarms pose 'credible threat' to USS Abraham Lincoln carrier group, defense expert says
item.description: USS Abraham Lincoln strike group approaches Middle East amid warnings that Iranian drone capabilities worth "tens of millions of dollars" threaten U.S. naval vessels.

item.title: Israel announces limited reopening of Rafah Crossing under Trump’s 20-point plan
item.description: Netanyahu agrees to reopen Gaza's Rafah crossing under President Trump's 20-point peace plan, pending the recovery of the final Israeli hostage.

item.title: Italy’s Meloni rebukes Trump remarks on NATO’s role in Afghanistan
item.description: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni calls Trump's NATO comments about Afghanistan "unacceptable," defending Italy's sacrifice of 53 soldiers killed in the conflict.

item.title: JD Vance shares ‘crazy' story of ICE and CBP officers being mobbed in Minneapolis
item.description: JD Vance said off-duty ICE and CBP officers were doxxed, mobbed and trapped in a Minneapolis restaurant, blaming local leaders for refusing to cooperate with immigration enforcement.

item.title: Josh Shapiro accuses Harris' vetting team of making disrespectful commentary toward his wife
item.description: Pennsylvania governor Josh Shapiro said Kamala Harris' vetting team wasn't respectful to his wife during the interviews he went through as Harris selected her running mate.

item.title: Kristen Stewart plans dramatic exit from US over Trump's America-first film industry policies
item.description: Kristen Stewart is considering leaving the U.S. due to President Trump's policies, saying she "can't work freely" in America and plans to make films in Europe instead.

item.title: Macron says children's brains are 'not for sale,' urges fast-track to ban social media for kids under 15
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron pushes lawmakers to ban social media for kids under 15, saying children's emotions won't be manipulated by "American Platforms" or "Chinese algorithms."

item.title: NFL fans torch Rams returner after muffed punt leads to crucial Seahawks touchdown
item.description: Los Angeles Rams returner Xavier Smith faced immense criticism after he muffed a punt at a critical moment of their NFC Championship Game against the Seattle Seahawks.

item.title: Patriots head back to Super Bowl after narrow AFC title win over Broncos
item.description: The Denver Broncos and New England Patriots on Sunday battled to see who would represent the AFC in Super Bowl next month. The Patriots came out on top.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle make Sundance debut as they premiere Girl Scout documentary
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle walked the red carpet at Sundance film festival as the Duchess of Sussex surprised audiences with a heartfelt speech about "Cookie Queens."

item.title: Republican governor believes Trump is getting 'bad advice' on immigration amid outrage over MN shooting
item.description: Oklahoma Gov. Kevin Stitt disagrees with President Donald Trump's immigration policies after the deadly shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis on Saturday.

item.title: Seahawks earn trip to Super Bowl LX with thrilling victory over Rams in NFC Championship Game
item.description: The Seattle Seahawks are heading back to the Super Bowl, as they defeated the Los Angeles Rams, 31-27, in a thrilling NFC Championship Game

item.title: Soap opera star refuses to 'even look' at Carrie Underwood after Trump inauguration performance
item.description: "General Hospital" star Nancy Lee Grahn claimed on Threads that she refuses to look at Carrie Underwood after she performed for President Donald Trump.

item.title: Super Bowl LX: What to know about the game
item.description: Drake Maye got the New England Patriots past the Denver Broncos and Sam Darnold helped the Seattle Seahawks edge the Los Angeles Rams. Super Bowl LX is set.

item.title: Syrian militiaman shows off what he claims to be severed Kurdish fighter's braid as Damascus asserts control
item.description: A video of a Syrian fighter holding a braid he claims was taken from a Kurdish woman in Raqqa sparked outrage and protests as Damascus expands control amid a fragile ceasefire.

item.title: The far-left network that helped put Alex Pretti in harm's way, then made him a martyr
item.description: Encrypted chats show activists tracked ICE agents using a sophisticated database before the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis. They then used it to mobilize agitators.

item.title: Tim Walz compares Minnesota ICE actions to Holocaust and Anne Frank: 'Hiding in their houses'
item.description: Gov. Tim Walz likened Minnesota immigration enforcement to the Holocaust and Anne Frank after a fatal Minneapolis shooting that killed VA nurse Alex Pretti, saying children now fear leaving home.

item.title: Trump confirms federal review of Minneapolis shooting that killed nurse: 'Reviewing everything'
item.description: President Trump told the Wall Street Journal his administration is “reviewing everything” after the Minneapolis shooting that killed nurse Alex Pretti, as questions swirl.

item.title: Video shows masked robbers crash car through jewelry store entrance, steal owner's gun in brazen heist
item.description: Surveillance video shows masked suspects ramming a car into a California jewelry store, looting cases, stealing the owner’s gun and fleeing in cars that later crashed during police chases.

item.title: Warriors' Steve Kerr claims 'misinformation' in media dividing Americans after CBP-involved shooting
item.description: Golden State Warriors coach Steve Kerr claimed on Sunday that Americans are being "divided by media for profit" and "misinformation" after a Border Patrol-involved deadly shooting.

item.title: Zelenskyy touts ‘constructive’ trilateral talks between the US, Russia and Ukraine in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Ukraine's Zelenskyy calls recent US-Russia-Ukraine talks in Abu Dhabi "constructive," marking potential breakthrough in diplomatic efforts to end the war.

item.title: Another Christian community at risk in Africa as extremists and war take their toll
item.description: Sudan's civil war has reportedly killed 150,000 people and displaced 13 million as Christians face daily terror. Government forces allegedly killed 11 Christians on Christmas Day.

item.title: Boy, 12, dies after shark attack while swimming at popular cliff-jumping spot: 'We are heartbroken'
item.description: Nico Antic, 12, died from injuries after a shark attack at Sydney Harbour's Jump Rock. Friends heroically pulled him to safety after the attack.

item.title: Iran Revolutionary Guard commander says regime has 'finger on the trigger' as US warships head to Middle East
item.description: Iran's Revolutionary Guard chief warns the U.S. it has a "finger on the trigger" as American warships head to the Middle East amid anti-regime protests.

item.title: Lindsey Graham says there's 'strong consensus' to protect Kurds as Syrian forces advance on territory
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo warn of dire threats to Syrian Kurds as Syrian forces attack Kurdish-controlled territory in northern Syria.

item.title: Canadian PM Carney fires back at Trump over claim that 'Canada lives because of the United States'
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney rejected President Donald Trump's claim that "Canada lives because of the United States," declaring Canada "thrives because we are Canadian."

item.title: Iran's top prosecutor criticizes Trump's announcement that 800+ executions were halted: 'Completely false'
item.description: Iran’s top prosecutor Mohammad Movahedi is criticizing an announcement from President Donald Trump that Iran recently canceled more than 800 executions.

item.title: Russia, Ukraine to discuss territory as Trump says both sides 'want to make a deal'
item.description: Abu Dhabi hosts trilateral meeting with the U.S., Ukraine and Russia in a possible sign that the nearly four-year war could be coming to an end.

item.title: American OnlyFans star with Mexican cartel ties kidnapped at gunpoint outside mall
item.description: An Arizona OnlyFans star was allegedly kidnapped at gunpoint in Mexico, according to video. Nicole Pardo Molina's abduction may be linked to a cartel rivalry in Sinaloa.

item.title: Denmark's prime minister insists sovereignty is non-negotiable as Trump announces Greenland deal 'framework'
item.description: Denmark's prime minister said she won't negotiate her nation's sovereignty after President Donald Trump said a "framework" on a Greenland deal was reached.

item.title: ISIS fighters still at large after Syrian prison break, contributing to volatile security situation
item.description: ISIS prisoners escaped from a northeastern Syria prison, and some remain unaccounted for after chaos made tracking impossible, according to Syria analyst Nanar Hawach.

item.title: Russian oil tanker, the Grinch, intercepted as US, allies escalate sanctions crackdown
item.description: A Russian oil tanker was intercepted between Spain and Morocco as western powers intensify efforts to disrupt Moscow's sanctions-evading shadow fleet operations.

item.title: Trump pressures UK over Hamas-linked figure as US intel flags potential terror threat
item.description: U.S. Treasury sanctioned Zaher Birawi, 64, alleging the Britain-based activist serves as a Hamas senior official through a Popular Conference for Palestinians Abroad leadership role.

item.title: Iran accused of sex assaults on teenage prisoners, while families charged to recover remains of loved ones
item.description: Iran's prosecutor general Mohammad Movahedi claims government crushed nationwide protests as death toll reaches 544 with over 10,681 arrested.

item.title: Trump slams UK island handoff deal that could put key US military base at risk
item.description: President Donald Trump calls the United Kingdom's Chagos Islands transfer plan "an act of great stupidity," warning China could exploit the deal.

item.title: US begins transferring ISIS detainees from Syria to Iraq amid security transition
item.description: U.S. forces moved 150 ISIS detainees from Syria to Iraq as CENTCOM began a transfer operation involving up to 7,000 radical prisoners.
